ELEMENT.TITLE: Bluelicious (Web 2.0)
ELEMENT.SUMMARY:
This is an Ajax (Web 2.0) enabled theme which features an add to cart button which leaves your buyer on the product page. It features:
  • Two linkable banners (240 x 40) at the top
  • Ability to enable small CC icons in the upper right corner (profile specific).
  • login form appears 'on click' with form, link to secure login and password recovery.
  • Login link changes to 'logout' when a user is logged in.
  • Recently Viewed Items ( shows last 3).
  • Product Finder
  • Mailing list Subscription which can be turned on/off (profile specific).
  • Shipping carrier logo in lower right corner (profile specific).

    • Notes: the 'view cart' and 'edit cart' options are disabled on the cart page, since that info is redundant. The 'recently viewed items' page is disabled on the search results page.

ELEMENT.HTML:
Notes/features of this theme:
  • The returns/policies page layout is overloaded to r-20061003 to ensure compatibility with the FAQ engine
  • There are Two linkable banners (240 x 40) at the top (optional)
  • There are Two linkable banners (173 x 173) on the left (optional)
  • Ability to enable small CC icons in the upper right corner (profile specific)
  • login form appears 'on click' with link to secure login and password recovery
  • Ajax add to cart
  • Advanced 'accessories' list which, when no options are present and checkbox is checked, will add to cart with the default product 'add to cart' button.
  • Product pages are overloaded to a custom ajax layout (wiki only in descriptions)
  • Login link changes to 'logout' when a user is logged in and customer links appear at top of theme.
  • Recently Viewed Items ( shows last 3)
  • Product Finder (optional)
  • Mailing list Subscription which can be turned on/off (profile specific). Mailing list will disappear if user is already subscribed
  • Shipping carrier logo in lower right corner (profile specific | limit 1 | optional)
  • The 'view cart' and 'edit cart' options are disabled on the cart page, since that info is redundant.
  • The 'recently viewed items' page is disabled on the search results page.
  • 4 custom text blocks, one for each type of page: top level (home, about, etc), category, product and secure (Wiki only). All of these are optional and all have a fixed width of 173 pixels. Any content wider than that width will be hidden. This is to ensure the aesthetic of the theme. Text will wrap.
  • 'Proceed to checkout' button that appears only once an item is in the cart. (after load/reload)
  • Sidebar that supports images less than 173 pixels wide (crops off the rest) to preserve the aesthetic of theme
  • Breadcrumb on category pages instead of page title (in blue horizontal below the cart).
 Release Notes:
2007-04-23:
  • Added 'continue shopping' and 'checkout' buttons to ajax cart.
  • Set visible cart to update when 'add to cart' is pressed
2007-05-09:
  • Upgraded TAF ajax
  • Added keyword auto-completion
  • Upgraded to latest Prototype library

Optional Search Settings:
    The search catalog will default to blank. You can select a search catalog by clicking on the 'edit' link next to that prompt. Search catalogs are created elsewhere. Click here for instructions. Search catalogs are an advanced topic. If you need assistance, please schedule time with an implementation specialist.

ELEMENT.HELPER: Be sure to set your catalog to all upper case. Set to DEFAULT if you don't know what this is.

ELEMENT.HELP:
Search mode has three options:
  • 'and' which will do a search and return results for product with BOTH words that are searched (X and Y) - system default
  • 'or' which will do a search and return results for product with EITHER words that are searched (X or Y) - returns most results
  • 'exact' which will do a search and return results for product with exact word(s) that are searched - returns least results
    • If you have questions, please schedule time with a trainer.

ELEMENT.HTML:
Optional Product Settings:
    The product layout that is forced on by this theme has some editable options. Use the prompts below to turn features on/off.

ELEMENT.HELP:
Tell a Friend or TAF is a feature that puts a contact form on your product pages so that your customers can send product specific information directly to an associate of theirs. Your branding and product specific information are in the email sent, as well as a custom message set by your customer.
This feature requires the XSELL bundle.

Product Reviews allows your customers to add their personal input about a specific product. Once their review is submitted, it is entered into a queue for your approval. You have the ability to add/remove/edit any specific review through the product editor.
This feature requires the CRM bundle.

ELEMENT.HTML:
Theme Optional Graphics and Banners:
    Bluelicious has two editable banners that appear at the top of the theme and an additional two that appear on the left. Each banner has an associated text box that can be used to link the banner to another page. Specific linking conventions should be used, especially when linking between specialty stores. Click here to read more about setting up links on banners.

    Up to four cc icons can be enabled for the upper right corner.
    One shipping logo can be selected for the lower right corner.

ELEMENT.PROMPT: Primary Shipping Partner (there's only room for one)
ELEMENT.HELP: Please select your primary shipping partner. This theme has only enough room for one graphic in the footer. If you need additional shipping icons, use the sidebar feature instead.

ELEMENT.HTML:
Optional Text blocks for the left side:

    The following text blocks will appear near the bottom (just above the sidebar) of the left column. There are four different texts that you can use throughout your site so that you can change your messaging as your buyers surf.

    Notes:
  • The Secure text does not support html
  • The text boxes have a fixed width of 160px. Any content wider than that will dissappear (text will wrap). This is not a bug, it is done to preserve the aesthetic of the theme.

ELEMENT.PROMPT: Custom text for top level pages (wiki only)
ELEMENT.HELPER: This text will appear on all your top level pages (home, about, returns, etc) but NOT on product or Category pages or on secure pages (login or checkout).
This text will appear on all your category pages.
ELEMENT.PROMPT: Custom text for category pages (wiki only)

ELEMENT.HELPER: This text will appear on all your product pages.
ELEMENT.PROMPT: Custom text for product pages (wiki only)
Custom text for secure pages (wiki only)
ELEMENT.HELPER: This text will appear on all your secure pages (login, checkout, etc) and does NOT support HTML. Use wiki for formatting. HTML is not supported to ensure no SSL errors are caused due to improperly referenced files.

ELEMENT.HTML:
Optional Theme Settings:
    Turning the newsletter prompt on will display a newsletter subscription box in the left column of the theme. If a customer is logged in AND already subscribed to the newsletter, the form will not appear.

    The newsletter prompt allows you to enter a short piece of text that will appear below the newsletter header and above the form. (100 characters max), no html. This text will only appear if the newsletter form appears.

ELEMENT.PROMPT: Newsletter text (No HTML or WIKI | optional)
Display newsletter subscription form on left

ELEMENT.HTML:
